reasoning: Dyskeratosis congenita is a rare inherited bone marrow failure syndrome with heterogeneous inheritance patterns (autosomal dominant, recessive, X-linked). Prevalence estimated at 0.5 per 100k based on clinical registry data; incidence not well-documented. Genetic conditions are better measured by prevalence than incidence.
source: Dokal I et al. (2010). Dyskeratosis Congenita. In: Pagon RA et al., eds. GeneReviews. University of Washington
